story.title: Beneath Your Mask - Episode 2
story.storyDescription: An anonymous admirer is texting Heather at a costume party‚Ä¶
story.creator: web-uploader

author.bio: Chris Marie Green writes hot contemporary romance (like ‚ÄúBedroomies‚Äù!) plus urban fantasy. She also loves devouring pop culture and avoiding international incidents while traveling.

story.prePaywallNotification: Did Heather just spot her secret admirer? ü¶á‚ù§Ô∏è Tap back into Hooked to find out.
story.postPaywallNotification: Poor Heather! She only wants this flirtation with her secret admirer to be a fantasy üò¢ Will he still be interested? Tap back into Hooked to find out.

messages.text: Hah! I‚Äôve got you!
Heather challenges Batman with a cheeky stare from across the room.
Well, ‚Äúridiculously hot.‚Äù
Then again, when SHE‚ÄôS not wearing her Captain-ette America costume, no one would accuse her of being the same.
As Batman drunkenly sways while checking her out, her phone buzzes with a text.
Hate to break the news, but‚Ä¶
WRONG superhero.
Phew! I thought you were the Crapped Crusader who‚Äôs standing near the stairs.
Darlin‚Äô, I don‚Äôt think he‚Äôs even capable of using his clumsy thumbs to send a text right now.
He looks like he‚Äôd be ALL thumbs if he got a girl alone.
It sounds like you‚Äôre expecting a man who knows what to do with all his fingers.
A flash of heat rips through her, followed by a shiver of YES.
You know, it‚Äôs kind of a bummer that you‚Äôre not Batman‚Ä¶
Because my thoughts on him? HUBBA.
You wouldn‚Äôt kick him out of bed for eating Batcrackers?
Well, you know what they say‚Ä¶Marry Superman, bang Batman.
I‚Äôve got my priorities straight.
Hell, I‚Äôm not Superman. But Batman‚Ä¶?
Let‚Äôs just say you‚Äôre close, but you‚Äôre not there just yet.
Heather absorbs this latest clue‚Ä¶
And that brings us to another hint‚Ä¶
I‚Äôm a kick-ass martial artist who can do things even Batman can‚Äôt.
Huh. Batman is kind of good at everything even though he doesn‚Äôt have superpowers.
Not to brag, but‚Ä¶he‚Äôs got nothing on me.
üôÑ
LOL. I can say with authority that I‚Äôm at least far more emotionally stable than Bats.
Who isn‚Äôt?
üí•
LOL
You know, I have to confess‚Ä¶ I almost didn‚Äôt come to this party, but I‚Äôm glad I did.
My horny, date-obsessed mom saw this event on a meetup board and sent me the link.
Don‚Äôt tell me ‚Äî you just came here because of the costumes?
I told you I‚Äôm a sucker for cosplay.
There must‚Äôve been some kind of silver fox-cougar Internet alert‚Ä¶
MY single dad actually told ME about this meetup.
I came here with coworkers, but I think they already hooked up and split.
Which brings us to a hint about me, the guy WEARING this superhero suit‚Ä¶
You could actually say that some people call my day job ‚Äúsuperheroish‚Ä¶‚Äù
Hey, are you still there?
Yeah. But I‚Äôm thinking that we should probably stay away from real life.
Sorry. It‚Äôs just that I could use all the fantasy I can get right now.
You‚Äôre right. We don‚Äôt want to go beneath the masks. Totally agree.
So it‚Äôs understood that neither of us is in this for more than fun?
I‚Äôm just making sure.
No problem. I can give you all the fun you want‚Ä¶
And need.
Are you trying to make me melt? Because üíñ
Cap, trust me. I‚Äôll make more than your heart melt.
Heather aches, feeling so ready and willing in her sexy costume.
Once I get you where I want you, you‚Äôll go absolutely liquid for me.
Now we‚Äôre talking.
How do you feel about finally getting to the part where we‚Äôre NOT talking?
We could have a hell of a superhero crossover.
There has never been a flash of heat hotter than the one roaring through Heather.
Tell me where you are. Then I‚Äôll tell YOU how I feel about doing more than talking.
Can‚Äôt blame you for wanting to see me first.
So come up the stairs to my secret hideout.
Heather bites her lip and adjusts her wig and mask.
With weak knees, she manages to climb the stairs.
Once she‚Äôs there, the landing is dark, leading to a long, empty hallway.
Damn, you look amazing.
Where are you?
A rough whisper comes from behind her.
Turn around, Cap.
Pulse throbbing, Heather turns to find a tall, muscular superhero in a suit.
He‚Äôs lingering in the shadows near a window‚Ä¶
Moonlight reveals dark, carelessly tousled hair and a mask covering his upper face‚Ä¶
But it doesn‚Äôt hide his wicked smile.
Her belly flips because, OMG, it‚Äôs Nightwing ‚Äî the hottest superhero ever‚Ä¶
